error.description: The master station has received an unexpected response from the CCU.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error associated with a logic problem internal to the CCU or possibly an echo on the communication channel.
Attempt the command again
From Commander, remotely reset the CCU and attempt the command again

error.description: The master station has received an invalid response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error associated with the number of data packets received for a single communication. This error code is returned when the CCU receives too many or too few packets based on the request.
Attempt the command again

error.description: A parameter supplied in the command string is outside of its valid range.
error.troubleshooting: A parameter supplied in the command string is outside of its valid range. Correct the invalid parameter and attempt the command again.

error.description: Checksum verification failed on communication between the master station and the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error typically associated with systems using direct radio communications between the master station and a targeted device such as a CCU, RTU or dial up meter. Communication timing setup usually plays a role in troubleshooting this problem.
Attempt the command again
Using Commander, attempt a loop or scan on the targeted device to verify communications
If the loop or scan is successful,
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below). If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab
If the loopback is not successful
Attempt to loop or scan another device using the same communications channel

error.description: The CCU address in the response does not match the address of the targeted CCU.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is commonly due to timing or buffering problems with communication equipment such as portservers or radios.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab

error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the original route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The master station did not receive a response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with a setup problem or possibly caused by a communications equipment failure
Attempt the command again
Attempt a loop or scan of another device using the same communications channel if available
If communication to the second device is successful, the error is probably caused by an equipment or setup problem with the original device.
Verify the targeted device's serial number and/or address
Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the targeted device is working properly
If the communication to the second device is not successful, the error is probably caused by an equipment problem at the master station
Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the master station is working properly
If the targeted device is a CCU, verify it is powered up and the selector is not switched to external

error.porter: Sequence Reject Frame Received... Sequencing Adjusted
error.description: The response's sequence number does not match what was expected by the master station.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with invalid timing parameter's set at the master station. Another possible cause is a field visit to the CCU resulting in local communications being used. Upon setting the communications back to internal, the master station may receive this error on the first request due internal bookkeeping mismatches. The master station will automatically recovery from this internal mismatch.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab

error.description: The master station received an invalid header in the response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with invalid timing parameters set at the master station. This particular code is returned when the first section of the response from the targeted device does not match what the master station was expecting.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab

error.description: Checksum verification failed on response from the targeted device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error caused by an incomplete or corrupted response.
Attempt the command again
Adjust the timings of the communication channel (Steps to find the settings are shown below) or the communication equipment itself. If you are unfamiliar with the timing parameters available, please contact Technical Support.
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
Timings tab

error.description: The CCU did not respond correctly to a reset request.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error associated with a logic problem internal to the CCU.
Attempt the command again

error.description: The CCU has rejected a request from the master station.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error often caused by a mismatch of bookkeeping between the master station and the CCU. Another possibility is a logic problem internal to the CCU.
Attempt the command again
From Commander, remotely reset the CCU and attempt the command again
If the problem persists, it may be due to a faulty logic card in the CCU. Replace the logic card or contact Technical Support.

error.description: The device ID requested does not exist or is not loaded yet.
error.troubleshooting: The devices may still be in process of being loaded by the servers, wait a few minutes and attempt the command again.

error.description: The repeater did not receive a response from the end device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The master station timed out while waiting for carrier detect on the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with equipment failure or improperly configured communication channels
Attempt the command again
Verify carrier detect is necessary for this communication channel
If carrier detect is not necessary for this communication channel
Verify "Carrier Detect Wait" is unchecked on the communication channel
Open Database Editor
View -> Core
Sort By-> Comm Channel
Select and edit the appropriate channel
"Carrier Detect Wait" checkbox on the General tab
Verify the communication equipment (modem, phone line or radio) at the master station is working properly
If the targeted device is a CCU, verify it is powered up and the selector is not switched to external

error.description: The master station was unable to read from the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or retrieve data from the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
If using a port server or terminal server, verify connectivity to the device containing the physical communication ports

error.description: The master station was unable to write to the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or write data to the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
If using a port server or terminal server, verify connectivity to the device containing the physical communication ports

error.porter: DLC Read Timeout on CCU Queue Entry
error.description: The CCU did not receive a response from the targeted device on a queued request.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated with marginal signal or a request to a non existent device.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
If the second device is successful
Verify the original device's serial number
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.porter: Route Failed on CCU Queue Entry
error.description: The CCU received a partial response from the targeted device on a queued request.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation with the original device

error.description: The targeted port is disabled or inhibited in the Yukon System.
error.troubleshooting: This is a Yukon system message, the port is flagged as disabled in the Device Setup.

error.description: The targeted device is disabled or inhibited in the Yukon System.
error.troubleshooting: This is a Yukon system message, the device is flagged as disabled in the Device Setup.

error.description: The master station was unable to communicate with the targeted device due to communication failure.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error typically associated with a failure to initialize the modem for dial-up.
Attempt the command again
Verify the modem is functioning properly

error.description: The CCU heard a response from a device other than the one it was targeting.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated either crosstalk or is preceded by a bulk communication error such as a timeout.
Attempt the command again

error.description: The master station was unable to connect to the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is associated with the inability to connect to or initialize the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports

error.description: The master station was unable to write to the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to or send data to the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports

error.description: The master station was unable to read from the communications channel.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a bulk communications error that is typically associated with the inability to connect to retrieve data from the communications channel. Built in methods allow the system to attempt to recover from this code automatically
Attempt the command again
Verify connectivity to the device (terminal server) containing the physical communication ports

error.porter: Address Does Not Match Expected Value
error.description: The CCU heard a response from a device other than the one it was targeting.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is typically associated either crosstalk or is preceded by a bulk communication error such as a timeout.
Attempt the command again

error.description: The powerline carrier device was unable to communicate to the connected IED.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error that is associated with using a powerline carrier device to query data from another intelligent device on the line. The error is returned when the carrier device is unable to communicate with the polyphase meter or other end device.
Attempt the command again
If possible, verify the physical connection between the carrier device and the IED

error.description: The device was unable to complete the requested command.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a Yukon system error that is associated with using MCT device configuration information. The error is returned when the MCT device does not have configuration information stored already in the database. An attempt to retrieve the configuration information should be should be made.
Attempt the command again
If possible, verify the physical connection between the carrier device and the IED

error.description: A connection to the TCP/IP device could not be established or a current connection failed.

ul.li: Confirm communication with TCP/IP devices by 'pinging' the IP address of the devices. Check the setup of all devices found unreachable.
Confirm the Yukon configuration of the TCP/IP device and communications port are correct.
Confirm the device's configuration is correct.
Physically inspect any unreachable devices for hardware issues.
Contact third parties to confirm operation of network.

error.description: A connection to the TCP/IP device could not be established or a current connection failed.

ul.li: Confirm communication with TCP/IP devices by 'pinging' the IP address of the devices. Check the setup of all devices found unreachable.
Confirm the Yukon configuration of the TCP/IP device and communications port are correct.
Confirm the device's configuration is correct.
Physically inspect any unreachable devices for hardware issues.
Contact third parties to confirm operation of network.

error.description: Checksum verification failed on the response from the end device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a powerline carrier error typically associated with marginal or corrupted signal received at the CCU.
Attempt the command again
Attempt communication on another route if available
Using Commander, target the device and perform a 'locate' command
In the Database Editor, edit the device's communication route and select one of the successful routes from the 'locate' command
Attempt the command again
Attempt the same command with a different device on the same route
Attempt the command on the original device and verify the signal to noise ratio (signal strength) at the substation

error.description: The command is incorrect or not supported by this device type.

ul.li: Verify the command string syntax is valid.
The firmware for this device may not support this operation.

error.porter: Control is currently inhibited for the point.
error.description: Control is currently inhibited for the point.
error.troubleshooting:
Control commands cannot be sent for points which are control inhibited.
Enable Control for the point and re-send the command.
Edit the inhibited control point.
Uncheck the "Control Inhibit" checkbox in the Physical Setup tab.
Submit the change and attempt the command again.

error.description: Request timed out.
error.troubleshooting: Check Yukon Logs for errors.

error.porter: The freeze check bit in the frozen reading does not match the last recorded freeze sent to the device.
error.description: The freeze check bit in the frozen reading does not match the last recorded freeze sent to the device.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a data validation error associated with the freeze check bit retrieved from the device not matching the value expected by the master station.
Send the expected freeze command and attempt the command again
Using Commander, resend the expected freeze.
Attempt the command again

error.porter: The frozen peak timestamp is outside of the expected range.
error.description: Verification of the frozen peak's timestamp as retrieved from the device has failed.
error.troubleshooting:
This is a data validation error associated with the frozen peak demand's timestamp falling outside the range expected by the master station. This range is defined as greater than the last frozen peak demand reading archived in the database and less than the timestamp of the most recent freeze command sent to the device. This error typically occurs if the device missed an attempted freeze of the registers.
Send the expected freeze command and attempt the command again
Using Commander, resend the expected freeze.
Attempt the command again

error.porter: The freeze counter is less than the expected value.
error.description: Verification of the freeze counter has failed. Device did not receive one or more of the last Freeze commands.
error.troubleshooting: The last recorded freeze count (in Yukon) for the device does not match the current count returned from the device. This indicates a freeze command was not received by the device.

error.porter: Invalid data was received for one or more data points.
error.description: Invalid data was received for one or more data points.

error.porter: There is no record of the last freeze sent to this device.
error.description: There is no record of the last freeze sent to this device.

error.porter: Invalid time returned OR time outside of requested range.
error.description: The setup validation data returned by the meter did not match the expected value. The device did not hear the setup command.
error.troubleshooting: The meter did not receive the setup command for the read. Attempt the read again.

error.porter: Invalid channel returned by daily read.
error.description: The setup validation data returned by the meter did not match the expected value. The device did not hear the setup command.
error.troubleshooting: The meter did not receive the setup command for the read. Attempt the read again.

error.porter: Invalid or insufficient device SSPEC revision.
error.description: The meter does not support the requested command.
error.troubleshooting: Please verify the SSPEC supports the requested command. Execute 'getconfig model' to retrieve the SSPEC revision.

error.porter: Verification of device SSPEC revision is required.
error.description: Verification of device SSPEC revision is required.
error.troubleshooting: Execute 'getconfig model' to verify the device SSPEC revision.

error.description: The transmitter is busy with another request.
error.troubleshooting: The transmitter is busy with another request, possibly from another system. Attempt the command again.

error.description: The request has been received, but may be delayed because the port is not initialized. Bulk communication channel may be experiencing connection difficulties.
error.troubleshooting: Verify the bulk communication channel is functioning properly.

error.porter: Daily read request already in progress
error.description: The daily read request is already in progress.
error.troubleshooting: The daily read request is already in progress with another daily read request. Only one daily read can be in progress at a time. Wait for a moment and attempt the command again.

error.description: Yukon is unable to establish a connection with the device.
error.troubleshooting: Verify the device's connection parameters.

error.porter: No disconnect configured on this device
error.description: The device does not have a disconnect to be operated on.
error.troubleshooting: Verify there is a disconnect configured in the Device Setup.

error.description: The request was denied because the PLC transmitter is overheating.
error.troubleshooting: Hardware Protection Mode.

error.porter: Command requires channel configuration to continue.
error.description: In order to collect load profile, the system needs to retrieve the channel setup information.
error.troubleshooting: The system will attempt to collect the required configuration data automatically. Retry the command.

error.description: In order to execute, the command must be provided a valid date.
error.troubleshooting: Verify that the date provided for the command is valid and submit the request again.

error.porter: Failed to resolve an IP for the given DNS name.
error.description: The system attempted to look up a network name, but the operating system returned an error.
error.troubleshooting: Verify that the DNS name is correct and that your networking settings are valid.

error.description: Point is missing.
error.troubleshooting: Add missing point.

error.description: The action failed, the timestamp was not received.
The action failed, the timestamp is outside of the expected range.
There isn't a node in Network Manager which is currently associated with this device in Yukon.
error.troubleshooting: Use Network Manager to see if this meter exists and is known to be paired with any RF nodes.

error.porter: There is no RF gateway associated with the RF node.
error.description: There isn't a gateway in Network Manager which is currently associated with this node.
error.troubleshooting: Use Network Manager to see which RF gateway is associated with the RF node in question, if any.

error.porter: There was an error while processing the request.
error.description: An unexpected Network Manager error has occurred.
error.troubleshooting: Check Network Manager server logs to identify the root cause of the failure.

error.description: Request timed out
error.troubleshooting: Check Yukon Logs for errors

error.description: This action cannot be performed on this device type.
Successful Read

error.porter: Troubleshooting tips for this error code are not available at this time
error.description: Troubleshooting tips for this error code are not available at this time
